content:
1. Rohit Sharma (Right-handed opener)
2. KL Rahul (Right-handed opener)
3. Virat Kohli (Right-handed middle order batsman)
4. Shreyas Iyer (Right-handed middle order batsman)
5. Hardik Pandya (Right-handed all-rounder)
6. Kedar Jadhav (Right-handed middle order batsman)
7. Ravindra Jadeja (Left-handed all-rounder)
8. Mohammed Shami (Right-arm fast bowler)
9. Jasprit Bumrah (Right-arm fast bowler)
10. Yuzvendra Chahal (Right-arm leg-spinner)
11. Navdeep Saini (Right-arm fast bowler)

The team is a balance of right and left handed batsmen and also has a good balance of all rounders, fast bowlers and spinners. The openers Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul are in good form and Virat Kohli is the best middle order batsman in the world. Shreyas Iyer and Kedar Jadhav provide the stability to the middle order. Hardik Pandya is a key all-rounder who can bat, bowl and field well. Ravindra Jadeja is a solid all-rounder and a key spin bowler. Mohammed Shami, Jasprit Bumrah and Navdeep Saini are a good pace attack, and Yuzvendra Chahal is a key spin bowler in the team.
